docs.lead_paragraph: Katha Pollitt argues that women should stop apologizing and reclaim abortion as a “positive social good.”
docs.abstract: Clara Jeffery reviews book Pro: Reclaiming Abortion Rights by Katha Pollitt.
docs.snippet: Katha Pollitt argues that women should stop apologizing and reclaim abortion as a “positive social good.”

docs.lead_paragraph: We know it simply as “the pill,” but as Jonathan Eig’s cultural history shows, its genesis was anything but simple.

headline.seo: Jonathan Eig's 'The Birth of the Pill'

docs.abstract: Irin Carmon reviews book The Birth of the Pill: How Four Crusaders Reinvented Sex and Launched a Revolution by Jonathan Eig.
docs.snippet: We know it simply as “the pill,” but as Jonathan Eig’s cultural history shows, its genesis was anything but simple.

docs.lead_paragraph: The young Yazidi girl rocked apprehensively as she described the ordeal that took her from her family, snatched from her home by militants in Iraq, then sold as a slave in Syria before finally escaping to Turkey.

headline.main: Iraqi Yazidi Girl Tells of Captivity in IS Group
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Yazidi Girl Tells of Captivity in IS Group

docs.snippet: The young Yazidi girl rocked apprehensively as she described the ordeal that took her from her family, snatched from her home by militants in Iraq, then sold as a slave in Syria before finally escaping to Turkey.

docs.lead_paragraph: The medical records of Thomas Eric Duncan, the Liberian who died this week in Dallas, contradict earlier statements from the hospital that treated him.

headline.main: Ebola Patient Sent Home Despite Fever, Records Show
headline.print_headline: Ebola Patient Sent Home Despite Fever, Records Show

docs.abstract: Medical records of Thomas Eric Duncan, Liberian man who died of the Ebola virus, raise new questions about treatment he received when he first sought care at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas; report shows that he was sent home despite having high fever even after medical personnel learned he had recently arrived from Africa.
docs.snippet: The medical records of Thomas Eric Duncan, the Liberian who died this week in Dallas, contradict earlier statements from the hospital that treated him.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Kevin Sack from Atlanta. Abby Goodnough contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and KEVIN SACK

docs.lead_paragraph: Viola Davis told a crowd of Hollywood luminaries that her drive to end childhood hunger is fueled by memories of growing up in "abject poverty," stealing and crawling through maggot-filled garbage bins to get food.

headline.main: Viola Davis Opens Up at Power of Women Luncheon
headline.print_headline: Viola Davis Opens Up at Power of Women Luncheon

docs.snippet: Viola Davis told a crowd of Hollywood luminaries that her drive to end childhood hunger is fueled by memories of growing up in "abject poverty," stealing and crawling through maggot-filled garbage bins to get food.

docs.lead_paragraph: A couple who say they carried out a "bucket list" of trips for their unborn son, who suffered from a fatal condition, say they feel blessed he could spend his brief life with people who loved him.

headline.main: 'Bucket List' Finished, Boy Dies Hours After Birth
headline.print_headline: 'Bucket List' Finished, Boy Dies Hours After Birth

docs.snippet: A couple who say they carried out a "bucket list" of trips for their unborn son, who suffered from a fatal condition, say they feel blessed he could spend his brief life with people who loved him.

docs.lead_paragraph: Part memoir, part reflection on business life, "Good Enough for the Bastards" is a bestseller by Anita Krohn Traaseth, former chief executive of Hewlett-Packard Norway, encouraging women to reach for the top jobs.

headline.main: Book Talk: Norwegian Executive Tells Women to Go for Success Over Perfection
headline.print_headline: Book Talk: Norwegian Executive Tells Women to Go for Success Over Perfection

docs.snippet: Part memoir, part reflection on business life, "Good Enough for the Bastards" is a bestseller by Anita Krohn Traaseth, former chief executive of Hewlett-Packard Norway, encouraging women to reach for the top jobs.

headline.main: An Over-the Counter At-Home Conception Aid

docs.abstract: Women exploring conception aids have a new option: The Stork OTC, an over-the counter cervical cap designed to collect sperm after intercourse.
docs.snippet: Women exploring conception aids have a new option: The Stork OTC, an over-the counter cervical cap designed to collect sperm after intercourse.

docs.lead_paragraph: Father Groeschel was known in New York for his efforts on behalf of the poor, and worldwide as a television personality who denounced modernism and news reporting on sexual abuse by priests.

headline.main: Benedict Groeschel, 81, Dies; Priest Aided Poor and Drew a TV Flock

docs.abstract: Rev Benedict J Groeschel, Franciscan priest and author known in New York City for his efforts on behalf of the poor, and worldwide as a television personality who denounced modernism and news reporting on sexual abuse by priests, dies at age 81.
docs.snippet: Father Groeschel was known in New York for his efforts on behalf of the poor, and worldwide as a television personality who denounced modernism and news reporting on sexual abuse by priests.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pacific Northwest Ballet cements its reputation as a transmitter of Balanchine traditions in its production of “Jewels.”

headline.seo: Suzanne Farrell Coaches Pacific Northwest Ballet Balanchine
headline.main: Original Balanchine Stars Help Turn Much-Loved ‘Jewels’ Into Heirlooms
headline.print_headline: Original Balanchine Stars Help Turn Much-Loved ‘Jewels’ Into Heirlooms

docs.abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews Pacific Northwest Ballet's production of George Balachine's Jewels at the Marion Oliver McCaw Hall.
docs.snippet: Pacific Northwest Ballet cements its reputation as a transmitter of Balanchine traditions in its production of “Jewels.”
